info.name: Books For You
info.description:
# Introduction
This API provides endpoints to access information from a collection of books, authors, and quotes. It supplies this content to the site https://booksforyou.me. The data is gathered from other public sources and loaded into a connected database. The purpose of this data is to help people explore the literary world by browsing and exploring new books and authors.

No API key is required for this API, this information is publicly accessible. There is no limit on API calls.

query.description: Filter books by one or more genres, separated by a comma (,)
Filter books by a range of years, separated by a hyphen (-)
Filter books by a range of page counts, separated by a hyphen (-)
Filter books by a range of average ratings, separated by a hyphen (-)
Filter books by a range of prices, separated by a hyphen (-)
Sort books by <attribute name>-<order>, where order is A (ascending) or D (descending)

request.description:
Returns a list of all books.

Accepts different query parameters for filtering and sorting.

response.name: Default
response.body:
{
    "results": 2150,
    "books": [
        {
            "purchase_link": null,
            "language": "en",
            "avg_rating": 3.0,
            "description": "Traces the fateful period after the Earth is decimated by catastrophic solar flares and reveals the stories behind the formation of WICKED, the construction of the Glade, and Thomas' entry into the Maze.",
            "year": "2014-01-07",
            "author_names": [
                "James Dashner"
            ],
            "num_ratings": 46,
            "maturity_rating": "NOT_MATURE",
            "page_count": 329,
            "book_id": 0,
            "image": "http://books.google.com/books/content?id=hRfTCwAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&img=1&zoom=1&edge=curl&source=gbs_api",
            "name": "The Kill Order",
            "genres": [
                "JUVENILE FICTION"
            ],
            "price": null
        },
        {
            "purchase_link": null,
            "language": "en",
            "avg_rating": 4.0,
            "description": "The first book in the blockbuster phenomenon The Maze Runner series now features chapters from the highly-anticipated series conclusion, The Fever Code, the book that finally reveals the story of how the maze was built! This special movie tie-in edition includes an eight-page full-color insert with photos from the film. The Maze Runner and Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials are now major motion pictures featuring the star of MTV's Teen Wolf, Dylan O’Brien; Kaya Scodelario; Aml Ameen; Will Poulter; and Thomas Brodie-Sangster. The third movie, Maze Runner: The Death Cure, will hit screens in 2018. When Thomas wakes up in the lift, the only thing he can remember is his name. He’s surrounded by strangers—boys whose memories are also gone. Outside the towering stone walls that surround them is a limitless, ever-changing maze. It’s the only way out—and no one’s ever made it through alive. Then a girl arrives. The first girl ever. And the message she delivers is terrifying: Remember. Survive. Run. Also look for James Dashner’s edge-of-your-seat MORTALITY DOCTRINE series! Praise for the Maze Runner series: A #1 New York Times Bestselling Series A USA Today Bestseller A Kirkus Reviews Best Teen Book of the Year An ALA-YASLA Best Fiction for Young Adults Book An ALA-YALSA Quick Pick \"{A} mysterious survival saga that passionate fans describe as a fusion of Lord of the Flies, The Hunger Games, and Lost.\"—EW “Wonderful action writing—fast-paced…but smart and well observed.”—Newsday “{A} nail-biting must-read.”—Seventeen “Breathless, cinematic action.”—Publishers Weekly “Heart pounding to the very last moment.”—Kirkus Reviews “Exclamation-worthy.”—Romantic Times “James Dashner’s illuminating prequel {The Kill Order} will thrill fans of this Maze Runner {series} and prove just as exciting for readers new to the series.”—Shelf Awareness, Starred \"Take a deep breath before you start any James Dashner book.\"-Deseret News",
            "year": "2014-08-05",
            "author_names": [
                "James Dashner"
            ],
            "num_ratings": 4,
            "maturity_rating": "NOT_MATURE",
            "page_count": 416,
            "book_id": 1,
            "image": "http://books.google.com/books/content?id=jcJWAAAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover&img=1&zoom=1&edge=curl&source=gbs_api",
            "name": "The Maze Runner Movie Tie-In Edition (Maze Runner, Book One)",
            "genres": [
                "Young Adult Fiction"
            ],
            "price": null
        },
        ...
    ]
}

request.description: Returns a list of all authors.

response.name: Default
response.body: { "results": 214, "authors": [ { "num_published_books": 5, "first_name": "James", "avg_rating": 3.875, "image": "https://images.randomhouse.com/author/94527", "on_tour": false, "gender": "M", "last_name": "Dashner", "spotlight": "James Dashner is the author of the #1 New York Times bestselling Maze Runner series: The Maze Runner, The Scorch Trials, The Death Cure, The Kill Order and The Fever Code, as well as the bestselling Mortality Doctrine series: The Eye of Minds, The Rule of Thoughts, and The Game of Lives. Dashner was born and raised in Georgia, but now lives and writes in the Rocky Mountains. To learn more about him and his books, visit JamesDashner.com, follow @jamesdashner on Twitter, and find dashnerjames on Instagram.", "genres": [ "Juvenile fiction", "Young adult fiction" ], "author_id": 0, "occupation": "Philosopher", "bestsellers": true }, { "num_published_books": 29, "first_name": "William T.", "avg_rating": 3.70454545454545, "image": "https://images.randomhouse.com/author/32133", "on_tour": false, "gender": "M", "last_name": "Vollmann", "spotlight": "William T. Vollmann has won the Whiting Foundation Award and the Shiva Naipaul Memorial Award for his fiction.", "genres": [ "Social science", "Science", "Fiction", "Biography & autobiography", "Atmospheric carbon dioxide", "Philosophy", "Art", "History", "Photography" ], "author_id": 1, "occupation": "Poet", "bestsellers": true }, ... ] }

request.description: Returns a list of all quotes.

response.name: Default
response.body:
{
    "results": 249,
    "quotes": [
        {
            "quote_id": 0,
            "author_name": "James Dashner",
            "num_syllables": 28,
            "language": "en",
            "length": 141,
            "score": 0.0772,

            ],
            "num_unique_words": 28,
            "link": "https://theysaidso.com/quote/james-dashner-i-felt-her-absence-it-was-like-waking-up-one-day-with-no-teeth-in",
            "tags": [
                "absence",
                "alone",
                "breakup",
                "broken",
                "day",
                "felt",
                "forgive",
                "gone",
                "her",
                "i",
                "i-love-you",
                "in",
                "it",
                "know",
                "like",
                "loneliness",
                "lonely",
                "mirror",
                "miss",
                "mouth",
                "need",
                "no",
                "one",
                "run",
                "sad",
                "separated",
                "sorry",
                "teeth",
                "the",
                "they",
                "to",
                "up",
                "waking",
                "want",
                "was",
                "were",
                "with",
                "wouldn-t",
                "you",
                "your"
            ],
            "quote": "I felt her absence. It was like waking up one day with no teeth in your mouth. You wouldn't need to run to the mirror to know they were gone"
        },
        {
            "quote_id": 1,
            "author_name": "William T. Vollmann",
            "num_syllables": 60,
            "language": "en",
            "length": 253,
            "score": 0.4215,
            "most_common_words": [
                "and",
                "to",
                "the"
            ],
            "least_common_words": [
                "wanted",
                "like",
                "bugs",
                "cowardly",
                "just",
                "from",
                "such",
                "usand",
                "have",
                "interest",
                "in",
                "cockroaches",
                "alone",
                "left",
                "be",
                "said",
                "had",
                "curiosity",
                "enthusiasm",
                "they",
                "blind",
                "great",
                "ants",
                "stolid",
                "but",
                "or",
                "only",
                "about",
                "i",
                "getting"
            ],
            "num_unique_words": 38,
            "link": "https://theysaidso.com/quote/william-t-vollmann-but-as-i-have-said-the-bugs-had-no-interest-in-getting-usand",
            "tags": [
                "human-nature",
                "perspective"
            ],
            "quote": "But, as I have said, the bugs had no interest in getting usand no great curiosity or enthusiasm about us as such; from the cowardly cockroaches to the blind stolid ants they wanted only to be left alone to eat and breed and eat and breed, just like us."
        },
        ...
    ]
}

variable.description: (REQUIRED) The id of the book to retrieve.

request.description: Returns the information of a single book, as well as its related authors and quotes.

exec: pm.expect(jsonData.quote.quote).to.eql("I felt her absence. It was like waking up one day with no teeth in your mouth. You wouldn't need to run to the mirror to know they were gone");
